name: Vacation Village in the Berkshires

reviews.text: The rooms were large and simple in need of some minor work. No extras like soaps,lotions. Be sure to bring your own. If you are going to cook be sure to bring all that you need as for there is nothing but pots,pans, dishes. Check out is at 10:00 am and no extra time or you will be charged. Nearest grocery store is 20min away. Overall nice place to get away from it all.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting for fall colors

reviews.text: I love this resort. This is my timeshare resort. I love this resort, because you can do different things in every season. The summer is beautiful, going to the lake, and Mt. Greylock. The fall the colors of the leaves come right out at you! The resort is in the middle of the mountains across from Jimmy Peak. In the winter, it is completely different. Cold crisp air, snow on the mountain at Jimmy Peak. Watching the skiers while swimming in the indoor pool, is so cool. But my favorite thing of all is, that this resort is pet friendly. It has three building just for people who want to spend their vacation with their pets. I love it. I can now take my two dogs with me, and spend quality time with them. They enjoy it as much as I do. It is like a second home to my family. We love it there.
reviews.title: beautiful and restful vacation

reviews.text: We did a timeshare last minute rental, so we were there for a week and it was a great time. Great unit, nicely furnished, great views, comfortable. Friendly staff, nice lending library of videos, great pools, great fitness room, fast wireless internet connection.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay

reviews.text: this is a cool place,if you like the mountains many people dont know of evrything that you can do here VT is not far up rt 7 if your looking for maple syrup,tanglewood is 20min away and the ski area is just across the street the resort is about 15 yrs old and run by the berkley group. they have lock off units for sleeping of 8 comfortably not flashy but definite rustic feel the indoor pool is great as well as the outdoor pool check it out for yourself
reviews.title: visitng berkshire concepts at vaction village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As timeshares go I have to rate Vacation Village as above average. We are a couple age 32, stayed for a week. The location worked out great for us. Powder Hounds at Jiminy Peak has some really friendly waitresses that helped us with some must see places around the area. The small country store at Jiminy Peak was okay for a couple of necessities. We also were able to find a few necessities at the Store at Five Corners and Cricket Creek Farms. We typically shop local produce at home so it was nice to find places to shop for local dairy and produce so close to the resort. The resort itself worked out rather well for the most part. Being a younger couple relative to the average clientele I believe I slightly threw off the staff upon check-in. I can look young sometimes so there was a little confusion as to whether I was old enough to check-in. But once we got past that the rest of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Not all guests are over 60 so it isnt a retirement village, its just a product of timeshares. The typical person under 40 isnt going to be able to afford the money and time for a timeshare. We got lucky with a voucher from some RCI members. We noticed about 4 or 5 couples that were younger than 40. I believe i may have been in the same building as Emma because we ended up next to a family with a young child that loved to run down the hall, but hey thats a kid and they have energy to burn. The first night they stayed I think they didnt realize how thin the walls were and we awoke at 1:30am to their conversations and jacuzzi tub noise. I think they discovered how thin the walls were by the next day and were respectful the rest of the week. It is unfortunate that you can hear basic volume conversations through the walls though. There isnt a lot that can be done about that by the resort short of adding insulation to every shared wall, and as a guest its not comforting to stay alert to what your saying and doing in your own bedroom so as not to make your neighbor a part of it. Now for the wi-fi. Ive seen the response from Vac. Village that the priority of the guests is not wi-fi in these days of smart phones and unlimited date plans. The problem is that I see a lot of reviews putting bad marks on your wi-fi. I think in these days of E-Readers it is time to bite the bullet and provide wi-fi to your guests. I think i saw out-houses on the side of the road that had free wi-fi. Charging $10 a day is really in the dark ages of providing wi-fi especially if its slow. The Radisson has had free wi-fi since 1995. I think a good start would be to offer free wi-fi for basic internet connection and email but then have a charge for higher bandwidth usage. But the speed will need to be addressed either way. To continue the review. The onsight nature trail was definitely better than I hoped. It had a couple surprises and was easy walking. I tend to take hard trails back home but after being out all day, walking this easy, pretty, forested trail near the room was a nice relaxing end to the afternoon. Then there is the bed. Short of putting in a sleep-by-number bed in every room I dont see how any hotel/resort could ever make everyone happy. It was very soft and i felt like I was being swallowed and suffocated by it but i could see how the right person could feel like they were sleeping on air. At least there is a pull out bed in the couch for a change of sleeping venue if needed. Last, the shower is big enough for two but the water pressure is depressing. A bulk purchase of shower head replacements for the resort would do a lot for the morale of the guests. Nothing like a good shower to make people forget about their troubles.
reviews.title: Nice place, just a couple things shy of excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why terrible? I purchased a 2 night stay via a promotion and the stay included breakfast and airmiles. They did not have a breakfast and staff was clueless about any airmiles.
reviews.title: Management Is Lax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a World Hotels site which is condos and time shares and available units are put up for rental. Quite common. But the TOTAL lack of response from management at the resort and at the corporate level is inexcusable The reservation was for 8/12 so I have given them ample time and repeated inquiries. This was also a Travelzoo purchase and they also have chosen not to respond.
reviews.title: wonderful experience-New England in the Fall!

reviews.text: So if you want a nice place to satay I can't complain but if you want management to respond go somewhere else. Too bad ....it is usually the generalk staff that needs an occasional tune up and not management.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Indeed, as others have stated-glorious mt. view,end of Sept. with all the Fall colors. We took day trips, just exploring the countryside. The 1 bedroom apt. was spacious with a full kitchen and it easily earned a 5 for comfort, housekeeping and overall condition of the property. The staff was always helpful and courteous. If Wi-FI is important to you, you do have to pay for it. we could live without it. Nice little family restaurant just down the road. Best to pick up a few basic groceries on your way,but the little store nearby has all basics, just a little pricey, we would definitely consider another Vacation village property.
reviews.title: This place is friggin nice, despite the gripe reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I had a wonderful stay. We had 2 condos with a small shared space between. The condos were very clean, everything was in beautiful condition. Very reasonable priced. Great pool at the clubhouse. Beautiful location right near Jiminy Peak and not far form Pittsfield, MA.
reviews.title: no food no wi fi or internet nothing to do there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a week in a B unit seemed nice until we heard the noise of the people/kids running up and down the stairs, loud noises until late at night. The light shone so brightly into our bedroom we had to sleep with air line eye pads.
reviews.title: First time at this timeshare ~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom so big, the kitchen small and really think they could have thought the design a little differently. Our fridge kept freezing our stuff, pathetic small fridge!
reviews.title: Not a lot of value for the money
Beautiful location, helpful staff.
reviews.text: IF you want to cook pasta, make sure you take your own big pot, as the pots are for small meals/families.
I agree with Deborah about the envelope, but still left a nominal amount as it isn't the cleaning lady's fault. Thought there was free wifi - NOT - you pay, and for VERY slow internet connection :(
reviews.title: Adequate at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area very nice, spent quite a few days there. Staff friendly.
reviews.title: Worst place we've ever stayed!

reviews.text: My parents book a week here and we came up on the weekend. It was GREAT!! the view was breath taking, rooms were very spacious and clean. My parents had a full kitchen and our room had a full kitchenette, no stove but 2 hot plates, microwave, coffee maker ( with coffee & filters), toaster, etc.. We like that fact that we could cook right in the room. There were also plenty of places to order from or go out to eat. A lot to do OFF the resort. The indoor pool was nice BUT it deffinatly could of been heated a little more. They said it was 84 but i know it wasent. The hot tub was very nice. They also have a gym and a computer room. Had to pay if you wanted wifi, which i think should of been included. $9.99 a day, kind of pricy if you ask me. Overall, i would deffinatly go back, and we already book another week!
reviews.title: Great Weekend!

reviews.text: We visited the Berkshires this Oct., with the help of our trustie friends at Trip Advisor, I chose this property. I have no complaints. It was on top of a hill with a beautiful view. Our apartment had all the comforts of home and then some. Full kitchen, fireplace, hot tub, dinning table which seated six, and a patio. All was decorated quit nicely. The staff was quit pleasant and helpful. Anything I asked for was taken care of immediately. The pool and jacuzzi were open from 10am to 10pm daily. Only draw back might be it is a bit of a drive to almost anywhere, but if you are planning to see a lot of places you are centrally located here.
reviews.title: No complaints !

reviews.text: This is our third time using my brother and sister-in-law's time share. They placed us in a "new" Apt. A which was considerably smaller than the older apartments. Three of us had little room to socialiize and enjoy meals. The furniture was uncomfortable and poorly set up to watch T.V. or to interact with each other. The dining area was one round small table compared to a long rectangular lovely table in the old section. The walls were paper thin. We were up all night from our upstair's neighbors blasting their TVs. The staff were very available to help out. Both apartments (A and C) were very clean- no amenities except soap. The pretty ceramic tile from the older units were replaced by ugly vinyl tile. I was mostly aghast that there was no recycling at this point in time. People were disposing of large amounts of botttles and paper. I took our recycling home. Instead of a gas fire place,(as in the older units), it was a faux -no heat fireplace.
reviews.title: Newer is not always Better!

reviews.text: Stayed at Vacation Village this weekend. It is a timeshare that functions as a hotel when they're not full. They rent rooms just like a hotel, and bill themselves as a hotel, but when you ask for normal hotel requests, they respond, "We are not a hotel," and provide zero assistance.
reviews.title: Not a hotel - which is what the staff will tell you over and over. Avoid.

reviews.text: Staff is surly at best. I did not encounter one friendly staff member. They acted like I was a burden on them. I called the front desk to ask if there was a grocery store still open and they told me to check my welcome packet and ended the call. When I checked, there were stores listed, with no hours. Couldn't check hours on Google as there is no cell service.
reviews.title: Internet extortion

aka: Vacation Village In The Berkshires Hotel
